comment: Brooking is a very interesting professor. Made class enjoyable to attend but tests were so long and confusing. One test was over 70 questions of just true and false! Really have to put in a lot of time if you want to get an A. A b takes a lot of work too. I didn't study that much and managed to get a C.

Very funny professor. I liked him until the very end where we had only two or three lectures and several days of guest lectures and movie times during the period between the second test and the final and he expected to know more than he taught. Other than that he was very entertaining
Information on tests do not match the information on the study guides he gives. Skips class a lot, so you have to teach yourself the material

History can be boring but Brooking makes it about as interesting as it can get. He is very funny and always making jokes.  Weekly online quizzes that are short and simple. Gives a study guide for every test. Must read the book because tests are not easy but do-able. Would definitely take him again!

Funny teacher. Tests are very hard. He gives you a "study guide" but they have over 100 terms on them each time so they don't help. Gives online quizzes which are usually like 5 questions. He's a nice guy but you've gotta work hard, read, & take notes in class in order to passget a good grade

Really funny professor that cares about his students. Expect to read a lot because there will be at least one online quiz a week (usually two though). Lectures aren't bad and he uses powerepoints and gives you study guides before each test. Tests aren't very easy though, definitely have to study and even then I only got B's.

Dr. Brooking was hilarious! Tests are very long and kind of confusing but if you read the book and fill in the provided Power Points then you'll be fine. I am not a history person and I understood everything we talked about. He's very sarcastic and cusses lot but it makes the class enjoyable. He goes at a great pace and is very clear and helpful.

Amazing professor. Buy the book. Online quizzes every week, tons of extra credit, extremely smart and funny, use the inkling online study guide (his questions are different, but the site helps a lot). Read the chapters and go to class. His lectures are important, but he talks about EC and the tests too. First test is hard, rest are easy.
Best teacher ever! So laid back and offers a lot of extra credit. Always willing to help you succeed!

Brooking is my favoriteee. He makes History interesting, plus he's hilarious. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it helps, since the test questions are from lectures and the book. He makes study guides for each test, which take forever but are helpful. Extra credit for each test. He cares and wants you to do well. So if you have the chance, TAKE HIM!

This guy is a GREAT teacher and person. I have never been so happy to wake up at 8:00am for a class before. Even if you dont like history all that much he can still make it interesting and fun. All tests are scantron (bring your own) and he gives daily reading chapters and quizzes which are really easy grades. I would take this class all over again
Great teacher! I HATED history and had zero interest. He makes everything interesting and doesn't bog you down with dates and facts. He makes it more like a story with some humor.

Brooking is great. He genuinely cares about your success in the class and will do what he can to help you. But he will not just hand you a grade you don't deserve! Your final grade isn't just based on exams, so you have cushion with daily quizzes and other assignments. I recommend taking him! He is now a friend that I will keep in touch with.

Very good teacher. Loves his students and loves to joke. Make sure you get the book you need to read it for the test. If you read the whole book and study it you will pass. Not an easy A but you have to work for it if you want it.Failed with high 60's on 3 out of 4 test and still got a B in the class.online short quizzes that work for fluff points

He's hilarious!! He's one of the best professors I've ever taken at KSU! He geniunely wants his students to do well in his class. Before every test he has a study session to go over whats on the test and study guide. I'd defintely recommend taking him!

Professor Brooking is a great professor, and he is hilarious. Attendance isn't mandatory, but go to class and take notes because a lot of the tests are based off his lectures! He has a lot of extra work so your grade isn't just based off tests which is nice!
His tests are very hard, and a little confusing.  I felt like I knew the information, but could not get an A on his tests.  If you want an easy history class then do not take this professor!

He is very excited about history and uses humor and sarcasm to make the class more enjoyable. Take advantage of his easy extra credit. Pay attention to his lectures because it is all on his test. Super nice and very helpful. Class wasn't mandatory but sometimes his quizzes were just attendance quizzes so easy 100.

I had Brooking for Hist 2112 and loved him so much I took 2111 with him also! He is hilarious, knows his subject backwards and forwards, and gets you engaged in his lectures. Very open to questions and discussions. Fair when he grades tests/papers.

Brooking is HILARIOUS! It's great to have a History Professor with a personality. It's definately a huge change from the typical monotone history professor. However be warned his tests are not so easy. His tests come from the notes and it's not just cut and dry answers you really have to know the material. Overall he's great and willing to help.

Brooking gives oral lectures and speaks fast. If you want to pass you have to go to class and study for the tests. Tests are based off of notes. Buy the book online, you can use it on his online quizes. He makes class interesting by occasionally playing videos, and has a great sense of humor. Over all not bad, just PAY ATTENTION

professor is good at what he does... covers massive amounts of material in short amounts of time. tests are thourough, if you dont study you will fail. excellent lecturer and teacher, if youre a history buff, this guy is for you.

I'm taking him now and he is an awesome professor. Attendance is not mandatory. Class is easy if you study and do your online assignments. There are 3 tests and a final and he drops your lowest test grade, which can be the final. His lectures can be boring, but his class is usually interesting. i enjoy going to this class. I recommend taking him!
The best history teacher I've ever had! He thoroughly enjoys teaching and is always available for help. Very funny, too!
BEST PROFESSOR EVER! He is so funny and keeps class interesting. You have to study for the tests, but as long as you go over the lecture notes and read the assigned readings you will be fine.

Best teacher I've ever had at KSU! I looked forward to coming to his class. He has the greatest sense of humor ever. He literally had a class of 250 people dying laughing. Quizzes are all gimmie points. Test are not to bad. But you need to study the lecture notes and from the book.TAKE HIM!!!!

Best professor I have had a KSU so far. He makes it entertaining and did not take attendance in class. Info from his lectures will be on the tests so going to class helps and read the textbook as well. Tests aren't too bad if you study for them and he dropped the lowest test grade and the three lowest quiz grades which really helps. Take his class!

This was a good class. Prof. Brooking does a good job at keeping his lectures from becoming boring, and he has a good sense of humor. Some test questions can be a bit difficult/oblique, but overall, the class fairly easy. If you're in a large enough class, attendance will not be mandatory and you will not have assigned essays.

Great professor who obviously enjoys teaching history. Humorous & positive. Teaches without bias (as far as I know). Posts a lot of readings & notes on personal website. Uses clips & videos. If you're in a large class, no essays. However, he does cancel classes at last minute, so make sure to check your e-mail before class.
I dislike history, but I liked his class.He does what he can to make sure you will do well on the exam.He can be funny.Says m'kay a lot.I would take his class again. =)
Overall good guy, there's 3 exams plus a final. You can only miss 5 classes. He does offer some extra credit. Not an easy class if your not interested in history and you have to buy the textbook.

Great professor, interesting course.Use the book's WEBSITE to study, he uses many of those questions for his exams.READ THE BOOK; he covers other/sometimes different material in class. Refuses to teach straight from the book, but requires to know both lecture & book material. Liberal, but respectful to avoid political debate. Large class=no essays.

he is the hardest teacher i have ever had in my life...if you love hist you will probably do good in his class..if you hate essays dont take him because he loves essays and they have to be very detailed

Great Professor!! Will do whatever he can to help, if he knows you are trying.  Test are a little hard so you have to provide Extra study time and he does provide a study guide. There are quizes but he pretty much tells you whats on there.  I Love his method of teaching with the video clips.  Awesome professor! I almost changed my major to history!

Lectures were interesting. tests were over reading from book and notes and some videos. i would take him again definitely. attendance is mandatory, only miss 3 classes. 3 tests and a final. "pop" quizes over readings but he usually tells you what you need to study for those too. gives study guides and extra credit at the end.
